body.name: Sheltering Angel: A Novel Based on a True Story of the Titanic

productInformation.name: Best Sellers Rank
productInformation.value: #6,534 in Kindle Store (See Top 100 in Kindle Store) #13 in Biographical Fiction (Kindle Store) #18 in Disaster Fiction #38 in Biographical Fiction (Books)

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 15, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Outstanding book on the sinking of the TitanicI
reviews.reviewText: I am a fan of the Titanic and I read this book it is outstanding it tells the story of people involved in the sinking of the ship who are not well known The story of Andrew Cunningham who goes to sea as a steward it tell about his life on many ships and then he ends up being a steward on the titanic it is so interesting to find out about his work on board ship and the relationship with the rich and famous in first class and the reaction of the passengers when the ship hits the iceberg and how they try and escape the ship or resign themselves to their fate The section of where he is in the water and struggles to get into a lifeboat is unbelievable . I would recommend this book to anyone who has an interest in the Titanic or wants to know something about what it was like. Very well done

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on February 7, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Interesting Look at a Tragic Event
reviews.reviewText: It took me a few chapters to really get into this book but once the characters became familiar I was drawn into their stories. It was an interesting way of looking at the tragedy of the Titanic. By bringing real victims of the sinking of the ship into focus as human beings with glimpses into their lives it gave the tragic loss of so many lives more impact. It is a well written, well researched, fresh look at an event that still shocks us 112 years after the "unsinkable" ship went down.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on February 13, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 4.0 out of 5 stars enjoyed this different spin on Titanic
reviews.reviewText: Andrew Cunningham is a 1st cabin steward on the Oceania and then he and his friend Sid decide to get jobs on the Titanic's maiden voyage. Told very well via different narrators (which confused me at first) but stick with it. Vivid descriptions of the ships, passengers, invented conversations but all mesh nicely. First book Ive read by this author--although her other books/subject matter don't really interest me.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 22, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Amazing story about the tragic titanic sinking.
reviews.reviewText: The author did a stunning job of telling this story focusing on two main characters. One was of the privileged rich, and the other a first class steward on the Titanic.. both of these characters meet under terrible circumstances, but each reach out to the other to survive not only the sinking but beyond.This novel made me very emotional, but uplifted at the same time. The Scottish blessing of the sheltering angel is such an appropriate name for this novel.I highly recommend it. I’m going to buy the hardcopy of the book and read it again.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on February 8, 2024
reviews.reviewText: This is a story of the Titanic, a story that has been told and retold many times. This time though the author goes into the lives of a few of the many families that were torn apart by that disaster. Excellent writing and good research made for a very good story

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on February 12, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars fascinating insight of this tragedy
reviews.reviewText: Many movies & books have been written about the unsinkable Titanic but this is a deeper look of the workings of a huge ship from a person other than a passenger

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on February 3, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars this story was personal….
reviews.reviewText: Even though we’ve read it & seen it many times before this author brought us a new story level in the very suites & on the very stairway along with each passenger-different than seen before. I had to stay, beginning to end, right along side them.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on November 25, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 4.0 out of 5 stars Very good book
reviews.reviewText: Ill give this book 4.5 stars. It was interesting and I learned things about the sinking I didn't know. It is still such a terrible loss even though it happened so long ago. I read this book because we recently went to the Titanic museum and also because we recently as a country lost a sub on a mission to the Titanic. It was sad to hear that the wife of that sub commander who perished was related to Isisidor Strauss who perished on the Titanic with his wife. History does repeat itself. Its hard not to be curious of the events.

reviews.reviewTitle: An Inside look into the passengers and crew of the Titanic
reviews.reviewText: Extremely well written, and excellent character development.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on December 6, 2023
reviews.reviewText: Found this book very well written and historically correct, the fictional characters being based on real survivors/victims of the sinking. It really brought the event to life, and although the actual sinking is only a small part of this story, the characters background and aftermath made it all the more real. Thoroughly enjoyable, would definitely recommend. (Don't miss reading the afterword which gives a follow up explanation of the characters involved.)

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on December 18, 2023
reviews.reviewText: The wrapping of a novel around the facts of the Titanic saga are interesting & moving. In today’s world not much has changed, greed for money & power still predominate. Definitely a recommended read.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on December 2, 2023
reviews.reviewText: Everyone should be aware of the tragedy of the Titanic. I couldn’t put it down . Very moving and touching.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on November 25, 2023
reviews.reviewText: thoroughly enjoyed this book as i've always been interested in anything to do with the Titanic,especially true stories of the people who survived the tragic sinking of the Unsinkable!!
